Reviews.Title: “perfect for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Heike R
Reviews.Content: Perfect location just a few minutes from the hippodrome, quiet little street without much traffic ( nearly none ) , breathtaking few from our rooms ( 201 & 202 ) over a moschee to the bosporus. A very nice and helpful staff cares about you. The rooms are well equipped and proper. Restaurant either on the top with wonderful view, or in the back ( a idyllic stone court. Breakfast and meals of good quality and price. We missed nothing and were very glad that we choose this hotel out of the many others available in Istanbul. When we come back to this breathtaking city ( not if ) we'll stay again in Stone Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: realleon
Reviews.Content: me and my wife we stayed here for 5 night this hotel was charming the room is clean and staff is very friendly always chat with us and recemended alot of good place.(oldcity tour and bosphorus tour was amazing)The location of the hotel was brilliant. Only a few minutes walking distance from Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia and Grand Bazaar. Will definitely be visiting again hopefully and will recommend it to anyone who wants to just be local to the most popular attractions of old town Istanbul and be served very good breakfast and somewhere to stay for a convenient price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: rose2nomad
Reviews.Content: Upon first glance, this hotel was charming and quaint. We were part of a large group and my sister and I were fortunate to be assigned one of their larger suites behind the hotel nearby the breakfast room. We found Istanbul's weather to be much colder than expected, so it was a definite plus to have a working heater. In addition, their accommodations (bedroom, bath) were roomy, neat and clean. It was also a perk to have access to wifi. If you also needed use of a computer w/ internet access, there was one available in the main lobby. Our first evening at the hotel, our group had dinner at the restaurant patio in the back and consider their kabobs still the best I've had during the entire visit. As for location - you really can't beat the location of the Stone Hotel. It's within walking distance (less than 5 minutes) to Sultanahmet Square where the major sites were - Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, the Cisterns, etc. Being that the hotel was on a hill, you could easily see the beautiful blue sea out in the distance. Even better was being able to go to the hotel's rooftop terrace to take in the stunning 360 view of Istanbul during sunset. The staff at the Stone Hotel was incredibly hospitable and kind. They gave wonderful suggestions of where to go and how to get there. If you needed help with taxi service, or even last minute cruise suggestions, they were quick to call the right people to help get you to your destination. The service was fantastic and if ever I were to come back to Istanbul, I wouldn't mind revisiting this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, service and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Flatlander39
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 adults stayed here for 8 nights in mid September. The hotel is marvelously convenient to the historic Ottoman sights, has a roof terrace from which you can watch the sunset and have drinks, and a lovely walled patio with lots of seating where you can enjoy the buffet breakfast. Wifi is available on the terrace and in the patio. The young men who staff the desk--most particularly Ramazan and Ebo--are knowledgeable, charming, and extremely helpful. Our room for three was good-sized and overlooked the patio but also faced an apartment with balconies. We never saw people in the apartments, though. The room with a double bed was a little bit small, but how much are you in your room? With the generous public spaces, it didn't matter. Our air-conditioner worked well at night and we even had a refrigerator in the room. Somedays the cleaning person left small bottles of water in our frig, somedays not. One morning we left for at excursion at 5 a.m. and the kitchen put a breakfast out for us. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rate to high for what is being offered”
Reviews.Author: A M
Reviews.Content: Great location. Within walking distance from the main highlights. But I would like to add that I felt that the price is too high for what is being offered. The rooms are clean but the shower isn't as it should be. There is blackness allover the silicone that is used to seal the edges of the bathtub and also around the doors from the bath tube frame there are yucky parts that I feel could be avoided when cleaned thouroughly. Probably a metal scraper will help or they just need to re-do it all. Yuckk. Breakfast was very simple, don't expect too much. There is no variation. Every day the same thing. The atmosphere...from the website you get a warm and cosy feeling but unfortunately this was not the case. Personnel is friendly but it doesn't feel natural; a pity. Another thing there desperately need to work on. Whenever I return to Istanbul I will not choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Convenient Hotel from S”
Reviews.Author: Seda A
Reviews.Content: My mum, I and a friend decided to book Stone Hotel as we arranged a ladies 5 day break in Istanbul. We were very anxious at first to what we will come across. However we had nothing to worry about. The hotel was clean. Our rooms were visited daily with towels changed and beds tidied up. Breakfast was from 08:30 - 11:30, but if you was 5-10 mins late there was always breakfast available with the help of Derya hanim bringing extras. Ramazan from the receptionist was very polite and helpful with all the details that we needed to know. Any questions we had they were answered thoroughly. We were confused with what to do on the first day, Ramazan bey recommended tour 9 which was a full day adventure of the most popular places in Istanbul to visit. The location of the hotel was brilliant. Only a few minutes walking distance from Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia and Grand Bazaar. Will definitely be visiting again hopefully and will recommend it to anyone who wants to just be local to the most popular attractions of old town Istanbul and be served just breakfast and somewhere to stay for a convenient price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: clarson
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers close proximity to all the main attractions within Old Town, Istanbul, at a reasonable price. The hotel is old and quaint. The staff is friendly and helpful in recommending attractions. Breakfast was ample but did not offer much variety. Our room faced the garden, which also served as a small restaurant. Lights and noise from the garden area were noticeable and could prove a problem for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Gonul”
Reviews.Author: GonulD
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews and seen the photos I and two friends decided to stay at the Stone Hotel. Initially we were a little worried as we were 3 females in a big city like Istanbul and it was the first time we had ventured out without our husbands. We had nothing to worry about! The staff at the hotel were fantastic, they were very polite, helpful with information and always on hand with any questions we might have had. The position of the hotel is wonderful, 5 minutes walk to The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, 10 minutes walk to the Grand Bazaar. Ramazan at reception is brilliant with information, he recommended tour no:9 which is a full day tour, it was the best thing we could have done! Our tour guide was very professional and full of knowledge. It is 5 days we will never forget, if you are worried about coming to Istanbul alone, don't be, just stay at the Stone Hotel as you will be in safe hands. Just a quick thank you to Ibo as he brought us his own electric kettle to use in the room!) You obviously have to remember that this is a 3 star hotel and it is not perfect,.i.e bathroom is a little old, if you want 5 star accomation then you need to stay at a 5 star hotel. As a base it is perfect and so are the employees. Thank you to everyone who made our stay unforgettable. Hopefully we will be back with our husbands and children!

Reviews.Title: “I am very impressed with the quality of the service and the location”
Reviews.Author: culpable
Reviews.Content: I have choosen Stone Hotel by the recommendation of my family who had stayed at this lovely small hotel recently. Hotel is very well located for the visitors who wants see the old city. It is only 2-3 blocks away from the old city square. Rooms are nice well organized and always clean. The view from the terrace and from the room I' ve stayed is wonderful. But for me the favourite side of the hotel is the most friendly and helpful staff of the hotel. I had a very short time in Istanbul but they made this time very long ,valuable and memorable for me. I would definitely recommend this hotel: good value, good location and above all excellent staff (friends)!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed and if we will ever get another chance to visit Instanbul, we will come back!! :)”
Reviews.Author: DalmaCP
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay, ultra central, the hotel personal offers you maps and advices. Ask for the room at the 2nd floor, it's more bigger :) Wonderful place to take breakfast, goof food and consistent, comparing to other hotels. internet acces 24/24. Give it a shot - you will love it!! Cheers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: OlyaEussa
Reviews.Content: Had such a wonderful stay here in July with a few friends. Stone hotel is in a perfect location, 5 minutes walk from main tourist attractions including the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Grand Bazaar. Stone hotel is also close to many good restaurants and bars! The staff were lovely, friendly and extremely helpful. They gave us great advice on what to see around the city, transport and also recommended good places to eat when out and about! The hotel was very clean, and we enjoyed the beautiful garden and roof top terrace! Thank you to all the staff who made our stay so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, beautiful courtyard”
Reviews.Author: moto_sgx
Reviews.Content: Stone Hotel is in a great location, a couple of minutes from the main tourist areas of Sultanahmet and the Grand Bazaar yet secluded from the main drag to afford you some peace and quiet. Hotel rooms are spartan and clean, but the courtyard is the best feature. You can just sit there, chit-chat a bit, and eat your breakfast, which, btw, is served in a beautiful brick-walled room. I liked how, after a long day, you return to the hotel and feel like going to your own house in Istanbul. The staff are very friendly and, like what many have said here, make you seem like family. There was some initial trouble with the pick-up promo, but the staff handled it excellently. The promised to reimburse me the cab fare, which they did even without being prompted. Make sure you go to the top floor and enjoy the view of the Bosphorus from there!

Reviews.Title: “flexible and helpful at all hours”
Reviews.Author: ccboca
Reviews.Content: What made this hotel stand out was the staff and the level of commitment they have to ensuring their guests make the most from their stay. We experienced the city in a way we would not have been able to without Ibrahim Eren, one of the night staff. One time we ran into him and his brother eating at a restaurant and we asked directions to the famous fish restaurant area, they were going to walk us there!! We insisted they stay and finish their supper but they gave us a card and a great recommendation and directions to a restaurant. Really the helpfulness was above and beyond, and we were 4 travellers who had so many different ideas of what we wanted to do but it all worked out. We stayed in the family suite in the new part of the hotel, it was adequate but tight. The bathroom and hot water were fantastic. The air conditioning saved our lives. We enjoyed the breakfast but coffee is not included which was a bit of a pain (good coffee I mean). The breakfast was the usual, sometimes it was better than others but it was replenished well and they were flexible with us late risers heh heh!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in a romantic city!”
Reviews.Author: BaukeKetting
Reviews.Content: I was in Hotel Stone last week with my family, I really like my stay there. The staff was very nice and helpful. The hotel is in the middle of the cetrum; shops, restaurants and many sights are in walk distance. Some more about the hotel: Every day they cleaned your room, good breakfast, a wonderful garden where we sat every night. And of course the roof terrace with a lovely view over the city and sea. The staff talked a lot with us. Every night when we got back at the hotel, we received a warm welcome. I really hope that I once go back to the hotel, especially for the hospitality (and of course for the delicious Turkish tea!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for Couples of Any Age”
Reviews.Author: agnesmeerhoff
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband, and I fell in love with everyone and everything! We dreamt of a perfect anniversary vacation, and we found it in Turkey. The Stone Hotel was marvelous! After a long day of walking around, it was always refreshing to walk into the hotel and be greeted by everyone who worked there. The staff couldn't have been more pleasant. The garden was absolutely stunning; it looked as though it had come out of a movie. Shops, resteraunts, and cafes were all within walking distance. There was also a breathtaking mosque down the road that everyone should see. The hotel's breakfast room was truly unique. The cleanliness of the hotel was fantastic, and the rooftop was gorgeous, with a one-of-a-kind view of the rest of Istanbul. I would definitely stay there again, and recommend it to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “It's like a second home!”
Reviews.Author: Helen_BB03
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Stone with family for years now whenever we go to Istanbul. It's like coming home whenever we get there. The staff is friendly and helpful and great to talk with. The rooms are comfortable, beautiful, and so very turkish in every way. The garden is a great place to sit and talk and is very quiet and peaceful. I love it more every time I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julie_Meils
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 days at the beginning of my trip and loved it so much that I came back for 3 more nights at the end. I would love to stay there again. The staff was helpful, fun, friendly and showed that they loved being there. It was like a big family. Also It is in a great location and easy to walk to restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff and lovely location”
Reviews.Author: M0nika_P
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in the Stone Hotel. I really liked the room 202 - it was clean, it has everything you need - even safe deposit box, nice new furniture. Breakfast is delicious - enough food to choose your best breakfast. Location is just wonderful - all museums and mosques in the old city are in walking distance. Hotel has a lovely garden and staff is really friendly with making you a Turkish coffee or tea while you are checking your emails using a free wifi. They have a computer in the lobby and guests are welcome to use it. They even have a small library with different literature in few languages. I would like to say thank you to all staff who made my holidays really special. The environment is very relaxed - you will feel like being a part of hotel's family. All in all the hotel is one of the best small hotels I tried till now. They really deserve an excellent mark!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: cylee3333
Reviews.Content: i stayed for 2 nites at the hotel.. its clean n neat... extremely convenient to the 4 major tourist spots.. just a short walk to the Blue Mosque n then fr there to the other site. Hotel staff are helpful.. can skip the buffet breakfast... go down the street n there's many restaurant... Macdonalds... starbucks.. etc.. if u travel in 2 or more.. suggest u get the hotel airport transfer.. 20euros/45TL.. though more expensive than regular taxi, approx 35TL.. but its worth the hazzle and safe. excellent hotel for a short stay n to be walking distance to the tourist spots. change only what u need at airport banks, say US$50.. the rest can change when u at the grand bazaar or in town.. better rates.. Make sure u walk around the hotels n remember the landmarks to bring you back.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: WarsawTurystka
Reviews.Content: Very clean and nice hotel with a nice "garden" for guests . Breakfast is served in breakfast room or in a garden. The adventage here is not only a pleasant atmosphere, but also a very nice service, caring for guests and their comfort. I highly recommend this to anyone who wants to explore the city and its main attractions of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest disappointment ever!”
Reviews.Author: irishredhead1
Reviews.Content: We dreamed of this "suite" in the "garden" with a jacuzzi at the end of the bed. It was to be perfect ! We found a damp dark room in a courtyard with an abandoned jacuzzi against the wall opposite one of the windows. No problem, the shutters wouldn't open anyway. The electrical socket beside the bed was literally hanging out of the wall; the shower fixture fell off the wall when we tried to activate it..... the whole thing... shaft, head, the lot. It was grotty, damp smelling and the gentleman who welcomed us sat us down to lecture us on how NOT to be done .... i.e. buy only from his friends! He sent us to the only restaurant of our stay in Istanbul where we were ripped off ! Stay away from this place. We ended up in Alzer in front of the Blue Mosque... same price but a totally different story. No jacuzzi at the end of the bed but lots of other star qualities.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: banane21
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon the Stone Hotel during one of the city walks in the Lonely Planet. From the outside it was so cute that we just had to enquire and ask to see a room (we were already staying at a different hotel). The rooms were spacious, clean, tastefully decorated and the amenities were modern. There is a courtyard in the back that would be pleasant on summer nights and the restaurant in the back had a lot of character, being part of an old tunnel that was excavated. We realize that we were there during the slow season, but we appreciated how the manager gave us a very fair price right away without having to haggle him and we instantly realized how much we were being ripped off at the other hotel that was far inferior! Just to make sure that this was a good find, we did spend the day exploring the city and other hotels (out of curiosity) and by the end of the day, we knew that the Stone hotel was indeed a great find. The thing that really puts this hotel far above the rest is the staff. You will not go wrong with the comfort level (that is a given) but the staff at this hotel is exceptional! Istanbul is a fantastic city but the people at the Stone Hotel certainly made it extra special. And I spent my birthday there and they went out of their way to make it memorable for me. I highly recommend this hotel. And for honeymooners or couples on a romantic getaway, ask about the private suite. We were curious to see it too, but were unable to take a look....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nd_rm
Reviews.Content: Stone hotel has all the regular features of a fantastic place to stay. It is located ideally, it has very comfortable rooms, great service and of course free wi-fi. But it is actually greater than the sum of these parts. The staff at the hotel are some of the loveliest people we met -extremely hospitable and friendly. We had such a great time drinking tea and listening to Turkish music in the beautiful courtyard. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “greatest hotel in Istanbul :)”
Reviews.Author: Zuwi
Reviews.Content: What i can say about this hotel. Easiest way is to say itÂ´s the best. Location is excellent, close to blue mosque, hagia sofia, grand bazaar etc. Food is delicious and chef is friendly. staff is very friendly, helpful and funny. Rooms are great with beautiful view. Everything is good in this hotel. I just love Stone hotel and i will go back there always when iÂ´m in Istanbul. ItÂ´s my second home :)

Reviews.Title: “exellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: istanbuldaben
Reviews.Content: Very very positive. Great staff ( prompt, responsive and helpful ), nice clean rooms. Staff could not possibly have done anymore to help.i was delighted with all other more general aspects of the hotel including emplacement in sultan ahmet old town of grate Istanbul Special Thanks To Ramazan for being so kind and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Vey beautiful destination with nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: haggag
Reviews.Content: Stone Istanbul hotel its really very nice place where you can relax, with nice guidance from Ramadan who will tell you about everything in Istanbul. People they are very friendly and helpful, you feel welcome from everybody everywhere with professional service . Nice place it will be not the last time, thanks to all the team well done Ramadan

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: david1333
Reviews.Content: Comfortable. Very friendly and professional staff. Good internet system. Great location and nice food. I loved the charming enterier of the hotel, the stuff was very kind and helpfull, the breakfast was excelent - very vide offer of food, location is excelent -in the very heart of the city, and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: IvanaLZ1979
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything: the perfect location in the old part of Istanbul. The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and the Grand Bazar are just around the corner on walking distance. The rooms are very comfortable. The best reason however to stay at this hotel is the service they provide. They take very good care of you regarding advice about the city, restaurants and take perfect care of their guests individually. Even birthdays don't go by without being noticed by the wonderful hotel staff. During my next visit to Istanbul I will definitely stay in the Stone Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, nicest staff, sweet room, delicious breakfast, Free WiFI!”
Reviews.Author: TaylorMemphis_TN
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at The Stone Hotel for TEN nights ( Nov. 3- 13, 2010). I had found the listing for the hotel on line and took it on faith and trust what everyone else had said. It is ALL TRUE! The location is excellent. You are literally steps away from everything- the mosques, the Grand Bazaar, the Cisterns, the tram line, the Bosphorus but in a quiet, private neighborhood. The staff is friendly, helpful, and fun. There is a FREE computer in the lobby and there is FREE wifi in all the rooms. We had just come from Egypt and paid $6 for 1/2 hr. and up to $30 a day for Wifi - so that is quite a savings. The rooms are sweet, the bathroom is large, and the breakfast buffet is more than adequate with cheese, meats, vegetables, bread, hard boiled eggs- more than enough to get you going. We got a great rate of 50 euros a night. I think it was because it was off season and because we stayed so long. I would certainly stay there again when ( not if) I return to Istanbul. If you stay more than 4 nights they will do a free airport pick-up. Because we stayed so long we also got it free back to the airport. Really, I can't recommend this place highly enough. You can't go wrong. Carolyn

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable, friendly, care, decent priced and great location”
Reviews.Author: vdscipio
Reviews.Content: A nice and friendly hotel and although in a quiet street, right in the heart of the historical center. Only a few minutes walk to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Topkapi Palace. A hospitable reception, good beds and well cleaned rooms. Topservice from a helpful staff. Nothing to complain about what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: 110degrees
Reviews.Content: Stone Hotel is a fantastic option for those looking for a comfortable stay in a clean hotel with extremely friendly service and in a prime location, close to the magnificent sights of Sultanhamet in the old district of Istanbul. We would definitely recommend this hotel where we enjoyed 4 fantastic nights accommodation and our hosts at the Stone Hotel were able to provide recommendations of all sorts: from restaurants and cafe's to the best Bosphorous cruise and roof top terrace for a sunset drink. Fantastic people.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: Sim0ne_74
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and clean, recently refurbished, superb location and friendly staff. Really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and a decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: isheenthisheen
Reviews.Content: Because of the good tripadvisor ratings we called Stone Hotel once we reached instanbul. They gave us a discount that made it worth our while and this turned out to be a value for money hotel. Its location is great. Close to the main sight-seeing. The problem with staying in the area is that everything is so touristy. So with convenience comes the hassle and expensive mediocre food. The hotels morning breakfast buffet that was included was adequate but nothing fancy. The rooms are comfortable and again - nothing fancy. In fact there is a lot of poor finishing. We were also first shown to a nice spacious room with a view but it turned out that the AC wouldnt work there and had the hassle of moving to another room in the night when we got back from sight-seeing. We had to move all the things ourselves too. The staff are very friendly and speak good english so its very easy to communciate with them. But they dont really go the extra mile, for eg, they were trying to get us to move the next day, no help with the move. They came to pick us up but didnt even carry 1 of our littlest of bags. So if its location and a clean decent hotel you are interested in, I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “It was very nice trip!”
Reviews.Author: SoosanKhanum
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not big, but very well located.It is not on the busy tourisict street.But Sultan Ahmet Square, Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque just a five minute walk from the hotel There is plenty to see and do in the area (museums, famous buildings ) and everything was walking distance from the hotel. The room was clean, bathroom clean, everything in order. The staff was great very helpful and friendly that felt as if i was at home. I would highly reccomend Stone hotel !

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moni033
Reviews.Content: The Stone Hotel is located in very nice and silent part of Sultanahmet area of Istanbul, very close Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazar and other beautiful places. From my window i saw beautiful view of Marmara Sea. Rooms are very clean and comfortable and breakfast always tasty and served on comfortable terrace. But the best is that i met very nice and friendly staff of hotel., very professional. Specially two of them Ramazan and Tahir the best guys i have ever met always helpful,kind and they showed me the most beautiful places of Istanbul. I felt almost like in my house. I recommend this hotel everybody who wants to rest and spend unforgettable time .

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and great location of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mag_1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in Aug with my family. Hotel is very close to most of the famous sights of old Istanbul. Blue mosque is only less than 5 min walk. Tram line is also 5 min walk from here to travel in Istanbul. Hotel staff was very much friendly (every one of them, specially guy named Ramzan) and more than eager to help you. It is a nice, clean, friendly hotel and would certainly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Relax, friendly, very welcome staying”
Reviews.Author: Ruud1979
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good value for money. The room was clean, the bathroom very clean, everything in order. Staff were friendly and welcoming and a great help. Once the toilet was damaged, they made it right away.The outdoor seating area is private but well-done. In the morning you can sit in the sun or in de shadow. In the evening it's very relaxed and you can get a drink from the staff. Location-wise this hotel is perfect for sightseeing. AyaSofia, BlueMosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazar are all within reasonable walking distance and it was very easy to find the hotel. Mosques are nearby so you can hear the adhan and even attend namaz. I woke up the first night at 5 o'clock, but the rest of the week i slept very good. I could be a problem for you, but for me personaly it didn't. The buffet breakfast was simple but good, fresh french bread with tomatoes, vegetables, cake, juice and different kind of toppings (peanut butter and jam) But all in all value for money wise, a top hotel. If I go back to Istanbul I would go back to this Stone Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: mastafong
Reviews.Content: It's a verry good hotel! The people who works there are verry friendly and if you need something you can ask it! We went on trips in Istanbul and the hotel arranged everything for us! i like Istanbul! because this hotel, i like turkey more than before!!!! Go to Istanbul "hotel stone"!!!! And btw it's near the grand bazar and sulthanamet! You can walk on foot if you want! :D Thanx for the wonderfull holliday on Istanbul! groetjes uit Belgie van Ilse en Phuong!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value with central location”
Reviews.Author: canadaian_travel
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my dad who traveled with us to Istanbul so am writing this review on his behalf (and my impression from interacting with his hotel's staff). These guys are excellent. As my dad is an older person they treated him with lots of respect and took lots of time to explain things for him. Two very nice trip were arranged for my father, my wife and I through his hotel. Rooms are tight but clean and somewhat nicer that other hotels in the area (also little bit more $$). Location is fantastic too.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate & comfortable hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Alexamck
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel are very friendly and well informed. There is a lovely outdoor patio surrounded by ancient stone walls (hence the hotel name) where breakfast is available. Breakfast is served up to 10:30a.m., so you don't need to set the alarm clock in the morning. The location is excellent, only 5-10 minutes from the Hippodrome, which runs alongside the Blue Mosque, so very central. Check their video on: www.stonehotelistanbul.com to see for yourself. One small tip, and a criticism of the incompetence of Istanbul taxi drivers rather than the hotel: the Sultanahmet area is an unfathomable rabbit warren to them and they were unable to locate the hotel even with the exact address and after phoning the hotel for directions. So ask the taxi driver to drop you at the obelisk (dikilitaÅŸ) in the Hippodrome (At Meydani) and walk from there....it will save you a lot of time and infuriation in the long run!

Reviews.Title: “It was a proper hotel selection....”
Reviews.Author: validatorv
Reviews.Content: Being responsive is the first important thing for me to choose a hotel besides the value for the money. While so many hotels in Istanbul don't care to communicate by mail and even their website was not interactive (however it looks so), the hotel's staff was ready to response. They tend to progress and I hope them to keep their faith. I am satisfied to choose a hotel in Sultan-ahmet area and this hotel was suited for me and my family. However there are many hotels in that area but we have found this small hotel a renovated, clean, and cosy place. I suppose this was a hostel transformed to a small hotel. You can enjoy the yard and the breakfast hall and there are cooperative and honest staffs. Something should be mentioned: There was no view from the windows of the room (at least for the big rooms). Sultan-ahmet is a compact area, so you must expect to hear the voice of birds mostly in the nights. Some details of the room could be made better (e.g: bath-tub caulking, bathroom's door closing, the quality of the room's cleaning, and providing a dehumidificator for the breakfast hall. Anyway, I enjoyed my residing there and I am quite sure that I will be back there, if I had a chance to have another trip to Istanbul. I hope they try to elevate their quality.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise in old istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dr_msahmad
Reviews.Content: Booked my first trip to Istanbul online and really didn't know what to expect. What I did find was an ideal location in Sultanahmet just 5 minutes walk from the blue mosque, hagia sophia and a further stroll to Topkapi palace. What's more, with the new traffic regulations of no vehicles in the square, the hotel is ideally located just on the edge of the restricted zone just allowing motorised access. Hotel staff were warm and friendly and the grotto in the back was a cool escape from the midday sun. Rooms were clean and airconditioned and the atmosphere most pleasant. Definitely a good family destination

Reviews.Title: “Puzik i Nushik v Gastanista "Stone" v Istanbul...”
Reviews.Author: jaicban
Reviews.Content: The receptionists were very helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel is right in the heart of Sultanahmet, everything being within walking distance, either to the sites or a metro station. The view on top of the hotel is nice; you can smoke a nargile waterpipe on the roof of their outdoor terrace, and enjoy the view while drinking a glass of wine or raki. The breakfast was a European-Turkish style continental breakfast. The rooms are a little bit small but comfortable, and there is free wireless internet throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: robertomodena187803
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed any hotel like stone hotel , it is very clean and has fantastic garden with old building , Marmare sea wiew . i will stay again in STONE HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun...”
Reviews.Author: jbinuk
Reviews.Content: Hotel guys were all great fun... very helpful... lots of good tips for food, bars... Perfect location right near Aya Sofya, The Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, etc. Will definitely go back... great place!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mobysmom
Reviews.Content: The Stone Hotel is not on a touristy street, which was the first thing we noticed and loved about it, yet it is only three blocks from Istanbul's center and main attractions. It is a lovely old building with an atmosphere many other places might try to copy, but this is the real thing. During our week in Istanbul, we walked easily to the Blue Mosque, the Haiga Sofia, Sultanahmet Park, Topkapi Palace, the Grand Bazaar, the Archeological Musuem and the Basilica Cistern. There are numerous restaurants and other attractions closeby as well. And it's just a short walk to the tram lines to connect to all the places that might be too far to walk to. There is a lovely stone courtyard for breakfast where the sun and cooing doves greet you every morning. The rooms are comfortable and adequate for people who prefer a practical, comfy night's rest to a resort experience. I haven't mentioned the Stone Hotel's best feature--its staff! Everyone was smilling, warm, accommodating, and helpful--we felt a little like we were coming home at the end of each day. I was traveling with my youngest daughter and son, and we were a little loathe to leave Istanbul, partly because we felt so comfortable there. When I forgot an important small bag when leaving for the airport, they put the bag in a taxi and got it to me long before takeoff. That's service! I can't thank them enough for all their kindnesses and plain human decency.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff in Istanbul, home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: looksgreek1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent! My husband and I stay for 5 nights, the first night was our anniversary and the staff made sure to take extra special care of us. The room was super clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was perfect. The beds are pretty stiff, but if you use the white blanket as a mattress pad, and used the top cover blanket as a regular blanket, it's not so bad. There is a mosque right across the street, and the early morning call to prayer can be a bit loud, but we slept through them just fine with ear plugs. When we checked in, our great host Ramazan sat us down in the hotel foyer (with comfy Turkish style furniture) and had a cup of tea brought for us. He explained several 'tourist info' things, and gave us recommendations to a few places, and advice about dealing with 'hustlers'. It was a very needed friendly welcome to Istanbul, after our 'deer in the headlights' train ride from the airport. Every time we went anywhere outside of the hotel, we left the key at the front desk with no problem. The entire staff was very helpful and friendly. They even took us down to the local Hamam (turkish bath). We really appreciated how helpful they were. Any time we needed a recommendation or help with anything, they were more than willing to accommodate us, and even go with us to places that were with in close walking distance (which a lot of stuff is). We brought our laptop, and made frequent use of the free wifi the hotel offers as well. They have a lovely garden, that was absolutely enchanting. Fine woodwork and stone work, a covered area incase of rain, and lots of beautiful flowers all throughout the garden. There is what the staff called "the breakfast dungeon", but you can eat breakfast out in the garden too. Both the dungeon and garden where great. Speaking of breakfast, my husband and I both agree, this hotel has the best continental breakfast either of us has ever had. Definitely worth staying in for breakfast, not going out. The garden is also where the hotel restaurant is, and although we didn't eat there very often, it was very tasty when we did. We tried our first Nargile (water pipe) in the hotel garden as well. It was wonderful! All in all, the hotel is very comfortable and has all the amenities a good budget hotel would have, but the staff is what really makes the difference. They take the time to make all the details perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and friendly setting for a stress-free holiday”
Reviews.Author: swanning_off
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel was excellent, any requests were fulfilled efficiently and enthusiastically. We were kept fully hydrated with apple tea and alcoholic beverages! The hotel is a little difficult to find at first but is within easy walking distance of Camberlitas and Sultanahmet tram and locals along the way were happy to point us in the right direction. It is ideally situated for exploring the main sites Istanbul has to offer including the Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar (although if the focus of your trip is nightlife then a hotel nearer to Taksim may be better). There are a number of good restaurants nearby (there is also a local shop closeby stocking some essentials). It is easy to walk to arasta bazaar and restaurants and bars near there. I would advise asking the reception staff about local turkish baths to use instead of the main tourist ones which are slightly pricier. The room was a good size and was cleaned to an excellent standard on a daily basis. Some reviews have mentioned being disturbed by the call to prayer from the neighbouring mosque but I was not disturbed by this in the slightest. Breakfast was good with a cold buffet provided every day. The roof terrace is a lovely setting to watch the sunset and to chat over a waterpipe. There are no shortage of places to quietly relax in the hotel if you wish. Overall I was extremely impressed with this hotel; the staff were very welcoming and made our stay in Istanbul pass easily and enjoyably.

Reviews.Title: “Stone Hotel is more fun and less stress!”
Reviews.Author: LiekeHeiloo
Reviews.Content: The Stone Hotel is centrally located in the historic old region of Istanbul (Sultanahmet) on a quiet street! You are at walking distance to major sites of the area like Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosk, Basillica Cistern and convenient to further public transportation. What makes this hotel special is the quality of service. Very friendly and helpful staff! Because of the Iceland vulcano we stayed longer in Istanbul than we planned and expected, but we felt at home at the Stone Hotel! The staff rang with our airline to reschedule our flight; no stress for us! I would like to recommend this hotel: good value, good location and above all excellent staff!

Reviews.Title: “Tommy and Lidas adventures in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: LifesRoads
Reviews.Content: The Stone Hotel in Istanbul has been my wife's and I second home for almost 5 years now. The staff is top notch and the rooms are cozy and well decorated. When are camera was damaged the manager of the hotel actually took time off his work and brought us to a repair shop. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone wanting good value with a excellent location and a 5 star staff.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic and unforgettible stay ;)”
Reviews.Author: alexAntalya
Reviews.Content: Perfect sweet little place in the middle of the highspots of istanbul. The blue mosk in front of the door but inside the hotel quiet little romance ;) Good restaurant, amazing locations and clean very very lovely big rooms. and of course the cool, friendly always helpfull ( also with insidertips) receptionist Ramazan ;) Thanks to stone *smile Hopefully again soon over there Ania & Mahmut

Reviews.Title: “"Great location"”
Reviews.Author: maya36ct
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at the Stone Hotel, loved the location, in the sultanahmet region of Istanbul. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast buffet was delicious, loved those olives. If you go, don't miss Rustum Pasa Mosque, exquisite. The hotel location was convenient to public transportation, and interesting shops.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: fishermanNewRochelle
Reviews.Content: The Stone Hotel, in the Sultanahmet section of Istanbul, and its friendly and eager staff surpassed all of our expectations. Our trip was basically one of sightseeing and visiting the museums. The hotel was ideally situated for our needs as it was within walking distance of many of the major sites and museums we planned to visit. It is also close to the tram which makes it incredibly easy to get around the city. More importantly, the staff at the hotel were extremely helpful in giving us clear directions and even stood outside the hotel to ensure that we started off and make the correct turn towards our objective for the day. Our 85 year old mother accompanied us on the trip and the staff went out of their way to help her learn a bit of Turkish and were incredibly solicitous of her. she always got and returned a big smile to the hotel staff. The breakfast was not American fare but we could have not asked for more. It consisted of marvelous bread and very tasty yogurt. they also had boiled eggs, olives, cheeses, tomatoes and cucumbers that were the most crispy and tasty that I ever had. The three of us shared a room and there was plenty of space and it was always clean. We hope to return in the near future and will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “only happyness”
Reviews.Author: MelEtJo
Reviews.Content: greatest personnel ever kind,funny and excelent advisor!!! mel & jo

Reviews.Title: “A cosy, hospitable hotel in the center of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Klara05
Reviews.Content: The Stone Hotel is a small, cosy hotel in the heart of the historical center of Istanbul. The service was very good and there was a familiair atmosphere. The rooms are not very big, but you have everything you need. Every morning we got a typical Turkish breakfast in a wine cellar. When you visit Istanbul later in spring or in summer, the breakfast is served on a cosy terras, which looked promising. The crew is very helpful to give good advice to visit some nice places in Istanbul. This hotel is the ideal starting point to discover the fairy-like city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel with nice guys at the front desk.”
Reviews.Author: tksorensen
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had almost a week in Istanbul and stayed at this nice lttle hotel on the hill. The view is amazing from the roof. The rooms are on the small side but definitely clean and cozy. The minarets are not far from the hotel windows so don't panic when the prayers blast off early in the morning. Quite amazing...by day 3 we didn't even wake up. For a short stay in Istanbul this place is great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice,relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: topcat07Uk
Reviews.Content: Pros Located in a quiet street Near to attractions Mini bar Buffet breakfast, not too busy Toiletries,slippers supplied safe in room Rooftop terrace,nice views Medium sized room Cons: Steep hill (if bad on feet not ideal) Taxi driver didnt know where it was,so an address is handy If your a light sleeper then the call to prayer may wake you. At the bottom of the hill theres a corner shop which was cheap. If you carry on walking you meet the river which is very pretty and relaxing to sit by. Great experience and I really enjoyed it. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Cool”
Reviews.Author: raymileski
Reviews.Content: The city is a hillside challenge; from the hotel is about 3 blocks uphill to the three key sites of the city. Staff, venue, breakfast - and the people in the entire city were terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sirinbaba
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Stone Hotel, recommended highly to me by a friend. The service was excellent and friendly. The rooms are comfortable. I had one with a view of the Sea of Marmara. The hotel is so close to all the historic tourist sites. The hotel restaurant is good and inexpensive. I would like to thank the staff for helping make my stay in Istanbul so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: realleon
Reviews.Content: we had a great time at the stone hotel..closed to the old city (hagia sophia, blue mosque,topkapi palace byzalican cistern) very good breakfast helpfull and friendly staff..amazing garden with the waterfall wery nice water pipe i am recemended all of peaple who want to viist in istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: swan295
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I go to Istanbul at Stone Hotel.I can recommend this hotel to everyone.Perfect location,very close to the main monuments.The hotel is very clean with confortable rooms and new bathroom.Very friendly staff, who make you very welcome. The buffet breakfast is very good.You can see the sea from the hotel.There's a beautiful view from terrace and there's a one gaden where you can eat or drink something.And price is very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic views, lovely garden,friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireRomar
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Stone House, not only for its good location , but staff members "Russell and Bobby" provided us with excellent entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “very good small hotel for good price”
Reviews.Author: CityNatureLover
Reviews.Content: Very nice/clean hotel in the heart of the city, close to all main attractions. I like small hotel where you do not have an overload of other tourists in the breakfast area, and this hotel was one of those. Friendly staff willing to help out and give tips on where to go when asked, but not pushy when you wanted to do your own thing. The rooms are clean and a decent size, very nice bathroom. The only disadvantage I found where the double beds were quite small en had two-person covers on it. When traveling with friends I would prefer to have two single sheets on the bed, so you don't have to fight over them during the night :-). The early wake-up call by the mosks is part of the culture and whereven you are in Istanbul, you will never NOT hear this.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in the heart of the Old City”
Reviews.Author: annjejo
Reviews.Content: Our 5-night stay at the Stone Hotel was the perfect ending of a month-long holiday (Italy, Greece, Turkey). It was quiet (except for the Call to Prayer from the mosques), clean, charming, and close to all the tourist must-see places (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace). The front desk people could not have been more helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel- would definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: julia525
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location- very quite street and less than five minutes walk from the main attractions of Sultanahmet, with a number of cafes and restaurants close by. I stayed in a comfortable double room which was very spacious, bright, clean and had a fantastic view of the sea. The bathroom was much bigger than I have seen in most hotels in Istanbul, and again, very clean with some toiletries provided. All the staff here were wonderful; always friendly, efficient and accommodating with great local knowledge. Breakfast was buffet style (bread, cheeses, olives, tomatoes, fruit, yogurt etc) and always fresh, with peaceful indoor and outdoor (courtyard) eating areas. I liked this hotel so much that next time I come to Istanbul I'll stay here again for sure. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danielforward
Reviews.Content: Very clean, well-run, friendly, helpful, beautiful hotel. Staff are great, Rooms and shared areas are immaculet. Great location for Sultanmehmet sites and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Turkish hospitality; in the heart of Istanbul's historic attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Meesch16
Reviews.Content: The staff of the Stone Hotel made our stay in Istanbul very pleasant. We were greeted with warm Turkish hospitality and tea; given a choice of very comfortable, modern rooms with air conditioning, mini-fridge and hairdryer in room; and helped to navigate our best routes and resources for exploring the attractions of Istanbul. The Stone Hotel is a beautiful place, it's decor living up to it's name, just a few blocks off the Hippodrome and near the Blue Mosque. It's tucked away across from Soukullo Mosque, another gem in the city, with a rooftop terrace with a view of the Sea. The price is reasonable for such good accommodations, including breakfast each morning, either out on the patio or inside a unique former wine cellar. Very helpful staff--knowledgeable in English and Turkish--in Ramazan, Selim and Esra among others. Choose the Stone Hotel for your stay in Istanbul. We will go there again if we get the chance. One tip: have your cab driver take you to the south end of the Hippodrome and get out there, walking the 4-5 blocks toward the water, or use the Stone Hotel's service to pick you up from the airport (one way free transfer is included). We got a confused cabbie who didn't seem to know where it was in the tucked away side streets of Istanbul, but we discovered it was actually VERY easy to find and only 5 minutes walk to all the main attractions of the Old Town, including shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for sightseeing in Sultanamet”
Reviews.Author: luccaLondon
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed for 1 week before going on to Northern cyprus, and were very impressed by this small hotel; Very clean rooms, a pleasant open courtyard in which to take breakfast ( good buffet). Our room overlooked a mosque, so be prepared for the muezinn call to prayer at dawn. The hotel is in the center of the Sultanamet area in a quiet side street, and is perfectly situated for visiting the main historical sites of the Blue mosque/Hagia Sofia/Topkapi Palace. Public transport is very easy to use and cheap, so do use the frequent tram service to visit the incredible Grand Bazzar. A trip along the Bosphorous is a must, and you can do this yourself by taking the IDS ferry at Eminonu pier ( see the blue dolphin logo on the boat) no need to pay a tour operator Â£30/40+, the ferry makes frequent stops along the way at picturesque seaside villages where you can take lunch very inexpensively. To my wife & I a week was not long enough in this enthralling city, and although we packed a lot in, we still missed much of interest. One final word of warning: There are lots of charming helpfull people in Istanbul, but do be aware of the conmen who invegle you with their charm and then demand monetary reward for nothing- we were taken in by a very smartly dressed man who offered to "guide" us round the Blue mosque, who then demanded 30ytl to give to the mosque charity box, needless to say the money stayed in his pocket !

Reviews.Title: “Great location with nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tomsur
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in this hotel. It is located very close to the main monuments (i.e. Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia). You can see the sea from the hotel. It is very clean and breakfasts are OK. The staff and manager are very friendly people. If you have any questions they are very helpful. They help in planning journeys, calling, advice on best places to go, etc. The price was very good. When I'm back in Istanbul with my family, I'll definitely stay there again. Tomasz from Poland

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel - very clean, friendly helpful staff, v/good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: gorilla5113
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in Jul 2009 - Excellent ! A really quiet hotel, in a location accessible to all the major sites of Istanbul. The hotel is very clean with friendly and helpful staff, who make you very welcome. The buffet breakfast is very good. We will be back. I would definetely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly and smiling stuff, relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: Karolina_Soltowska
Reviews.Content: I can recommend Stone Hotel to everyone, perfect location, beautiful view from terrace, relaxing garden where you eat really tasty breakfast. Rooms are clean and comfortable and everything is right at the cornen. Even oposite to the hotel you have mosque:) Outcoming stuff. There is nothing you could complain. Just go there! Karolina, Poland

Reviews.Title: “Just relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jessica0702
Reviews.Content: ...If you are looking for some fresh air during your stay in Istanbul in a silent street, the stone hotel will welcome you and propose you a nice and considerate service... Rooms are wonderful, breakfast was the most rich we had during our trip in turkey....and lovely spaces were thought (garden and roof terrace) just for you pleasure and tranquility!! Good luck to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Don't go!”
Reviews.Author: Happyeyy
Reviews.Content: Don't go to this hotel. I stayed there for a 4 days visit in May 2008. I arrived at the hotel at midnight and before I even set my feet on the hotel I was told that the hotel was overbooked and was shipped to their sister hotel, which was supposedly to be of the same quality as the Stone Hotel. The sister hotel is located in a doggy back alley, the room is half-finished - there are wires exposed everywhere, holes in the wall, floor tiles half-fitted, no shower - just a hose etc. The Stone Hotel staff explained that it is a custom in Turkey for hotel to accept bookings fr more rooms than they have. When we made a complaint about the poor quality of the Sister Hotel, the Stone Hotel promised to give us a full refund of the first night hotel rate. The next day we moved back to the Stone Hotel and instead of giving us the ocean view twin room that we paid for, we were given a garden view double room. We asked for refund for the difference between the rate of an ocean view room and a garden room and once again, the Stone Hotel promised to make the refund. We were promised that the redunf payment will be ready for our collection the next morning, but we never received a refund from them despite asking every morning and evening, every time they gave us a different story, one time they said they never promsied any refund, another time they said they would give us 10 euros in total. At the end I put my complaint in writing and had their staff signed in the letter which promised my requested refund. Despite the promise in black and white, the hotel still refused to pay and offer to give us free transfer to the airport as settlement (taxi to airport is approximately 30 euros, our promised refund is 160 euros). Fortunately, I booked through lastminute.com and managed to speak to their helpdesk before I left the hotel. We were told by lastminute.com that we should not accept anything and they would make the investigation and if our complaint is valid, lastminute.com would give us a refund. A month after I returned from lastminute.com, they wrote to me and said that Stone Hotel did not respond to their complaint and because I had the complaint letter signed by the Stone Hote, lastminute.com gave me a full refund.

Reviews.Title: “another great visit”
Reviews.Author: sezayi52
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Stone Hotel In March 2008 and were very impressed by both the staff and the hotel, so on our return visit to Istanbul with my elderly mother we decided to try it again. We were not disappointed, our rooms were beautiful, very clean and the service was excellent. The position of the hotel is great, walking distance to all the major attractions and tram service. Breakfast is taken in the courtyard and there is plenty of choice. Although there is no specific bar they do serve drinks with waiter service. These can be taken either to the upstairs terrace or in the courtyard. Thank you to Selam and his team for looking after us once again and we look forward to returning in the near future and certainly recommending the Stone Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: gsebire
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and our room had a birdseye view of the local mosque from our 4th floor room.Brilliant restoration done on a centuries old building with modern facilities.The guys running it were friendly and helpful.The outside courtyard and breakfast room were quiet sanctuaries to escape the fentic pace of this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JRSTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and the staff are very welcoming. However the fourth floor room we stayed in had a great view, but had objectionable smells coming out of the floor drain - which was only partly alleviated when one of the cleaners tuck a plastic bag in the hole! Staff are friendly and try to be helpful, but are not clued in enough to provide information excepf for the most popular tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “still as good!”
Reviews.Author: piboBelgium
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the second time in this hotel and it is still as good. One tip however: don't let - like we did - talk you into a day bosphorus tour by the receptionists: it is expensive and for me the trip felt like a real tourist trap! In fact, although they assured me that we would spend most of the day on the water, the boat trip is in fact quite small (just until the bosphorus bridge, without any stops and it takes no longer then 2 hours). The rest of a day you'll be in a bus that tours the city and you will spend an awful lot of time wating on other participants, guides, coaches... The tour even included a compulsary visit to a leather shop... Just take the public ferry if you want to cruise the bospohorus! This bein said, to anyone who is looking for a budget place I would recommend this hotel without any hesitation! Staff is friendly and professional, location can't be better, place is super clean! It is true that the mosque in front makes a lot of noise in the morning but for me that added just to the 'couleur locale' of the area where the hotel is located...

Reviews.Title: “If you'll stay...you'll come back”
Reviews.Author: GorgiaDaLeontini
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very clean in a marvellous location very close to the best sites of istanbul. We've been there 2 days at the end of march, and when we decided after visiting syria to go back in istanbul, we suddenly and without esitation decided to come back here.... Beside of this Aziz and Selim of the personnel, are really wonderful people. This will be for sure our home in istanbul (at a reasonable price) Federico & Claudia

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: SiberianFox
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel: great location (walking distance to Blue Mosque, Kucuk Aya Sofya, Aya Sofya, Grand Bazaar etc, 5 min walk to a subway station), freshly refurbished rooms, great airport pick up service (FREE of charge, very well organized), helpful & friendly staff. Though the breakfast choice was rather poor by our standards, i was later told that this is a traditional Turkish breakfast and in Sultanahmet surroundings, it was acceptable. There's a mosque just across the street so be prepared to all the related consequences; for us that was ok and only brought some extra autheticity.

Reviews.Title: “The Stone Hotel is Great and so is Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Smicks
Reviews.Content: This is truly a great hotel, Very well equipped very comfortable very clean close to the Blue Mosque and walking distance to almost everywhere else to. Breakfast was one of the best I've ever had abroad and the staff bend over backward to make your stay enjoyable, Would recomend to anyone visiting Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Excellent location Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: UK786
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located only a couple of minutes walk away from the Blue Mosque and so is very close to the main attractions. The staff are very friendly and helpful. No Complaints and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Great Hotel Stone”
Reviews.Author: captivate75
Reviews.Content: very easy location for visit al attraction.Hotel rooms ver nice view of the sea and staf very friendly. I have very good time with my best friends.they have nice garden and historical bulding.every where very clean.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Loomtronic
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend it to anyone. It's centrally located and is easily found (with a little help from people street). The staff was super friendly and their cafe was great as well! I really enjoyed our stay there and wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Manifico Albergo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in january ,and that is amazing hotel , it was great time for me , there is manificent garden , very historical and very beatifull , it bring me in period of Ottoman empire , and it is close everywhere , i didn't imagine all is close , Santa Sofia was just 2 minutes by walk , Blue Mosque was 1 minute , and i cant forget that fantastic day in terrace , i drink a glass of wine with great bosforus wiem , it was perfect ,and staff was very helpfull ,they helped me to much , i hope to return again istanbul and another hotel are no chance , of cours i will stay in STONE HOTEL . ciao tutti

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: FishersFarm
Reviews.Content: The Stone Hotel is a good, basic hotel, well located in Sultanahmet for seeing the sites by foot. The hotel is clean, the rooms confortable, the breakfast is delightful and the staff is very helpful. There are no meals served other than breakfast and there are no extras such as spas. As noted in other reviews, the morning call to prayer is at 6am and VERY loud.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: m0kat
Reviews.Content: We had a brilliant at the stone Hotel in August 2008. The staff were very friendly and always willing to help. The room was spotlessly cleaned everyday and had good facilities. The breakfast was served in a lovely garden with a water feature (nice touch). The best part was the terrace at the top which gave lovely views of the sea, old Roman column and the beautiful Sokullu Mosque. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend to others as it is good value for money. Thank you all at the Stone Hotel for our lovely stay. Mohamed and Salma - London mohamedkathrada@hotmail.co.uk

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CGNF
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Stone Hotel. The breakfast was great, the staff extremely helpful, friendly and knowledgable, and although a little pricey, well worth it! The view out to the Marmara from the terrace upstairs is great, and the garden / courtyard out back is a wonderful place not only for breakfast, but also to relax and chill out after a days sightseeing. Location is great - far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the main Sultanahmet area, yet within a matter of minutes (up a small-ish hill) you can be at the hippodrome (where the Blue Mosque is!). Also its only a 7 minutes walk of the nearest tram station - Sultanahmet (definitely worth using more than other means of transport). The only drawback is that it is right next to a mosque (i.e. very early and very loud calls to prayer)! Overall, a very enjoyable stay, the rooms are clean and very well maintained (although we did have a small leak in the shower) and rooms 1 and 2 on the 3rd and 4th floor are highly recommended for great sea views! Would highly recommend this hotel if you're staying in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but nice”
Reviews.Author: BathTripper
Reviews.Content: The Stone hotel is an interesting mix. Good things - reasonable breakfast, open air courtyard for breakfast, large room, roof top terrace with good views, very friendly and knowledgable staff, very good position, very good value. Not so good things - rooms a little run down, a glass window into the toilet area, jacuzi in the middle of the room but water spasmodic and cold, awful piped music at breakfast (particularly awful if you had too much raki the night before) the call to prayers being very close with the mosque next door. But the best thing - service with drinks to the roof top terrace, drinking raki and smoking a nargilah under the stars.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malkmus
Reviews.Content: Certainly no problems with overbooking for me. I arrived (very tired) just before midnight and was immediately checked in by friendly, helpful staff. The room was average size, but well furnished, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was very modern and spotlessly clean. Highly recommended. The location is great (very close to the Blue Mosque), but older or disabled travellers should be aware that it is on a steep hill.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: SonalSingh
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 days. the front desk staff were helpful and checked us in really quickly. the room was small but clean and the bathroom was good sized as well. the stone garden cafe was nice, though the breakfast was really terrible. except for the breakfast, the hotel experience was very good. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked and disorganised but in a good location !”
Reviews.Author: kitts1972
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Istanbul bet Sat 24 - Tue 27 May 2008 with friends. Just 2 couples needing 2 rooms for 3 nights. Booked the hol on 2 1/2 months in advance yet on arrival the hotel was overbooked. They only had one room for us and when we asked the receptionist for an explanation for the overbooking he couldn't explain why, seemed to think it was quite funny and the norm for this hotel ! 30 mins later we got our room in the hotel and our friends were offered a room in a hotel two doors up the road. This was for one night then they'd move back into a room in the Stone hotel the next day. Our friends ended up getting one of the 2 suites which in some way compensated their inconvenience for the fiasco the day before. Rooms were nice, clean and did the job for our stay. However, the Suite was nice but needs some work. Dated decor with some painting left incomplete. Lots of lights with very few working and bulbs missing. We did tell the guy on reception but he seemed to take little notice and laughed again. Breakfast was very poor, low quality food with a limited choice. We only ate here on our first morning and decided to eat elsewhere after that. Top tip when booking a rtn taxi (Private taxi) via reception....book it 30 mins before you actually need it as ours was 30 mins late. However, on the plus side we paid 40 TYL and only took their speedy driver 20 mins. Despite all the above we had a great time in Istanbul and the Stone Hotel was ideally located for us to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great locaion”
Reviews.Author: familyholidayz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stone Hotel with our toddler for four days at the beginning of May 2008. After the initial meet and greet we were informed that they had (as usual!) overbooked and that we would have to stay at one of the other hotels for one night. Luckily they put us in the hotel next door (Ada Hotel) which had a huge room. After a pleasant stay at the Ada Hotel we moved back to the Stone Hotel. Hotel The room we stayed in was a double on the second floor and had a double bed as well as a double sofa bed which accomodated us and our toddler very well. Breakfast was adequate (just a little limited in range) and was located in a very picturesque cellar. The courtyard was a pleasant place to relax and we later learnt there was a roof top terrace with a sea view but unfortunately it was closed until the summer season. As for the staff, we were really impressed with their warmth and consideration. We had free airport pick-up, they provided hot milk for our toddler at breakfast time (without us even requesting it), they booked private hire cars for our trips which actually worked out to be cheaper than normal taxis and when we moved to another hotel (where we were attending a wedding in Ortokoy), they looked after our luggage so that on our way back we could spend more time in Sultanammet before heading to the airport. In fact our friend who had stayed at the same hotel in Ortokoy commented that he would have preferred staying at the Stone Hotel because of the location and staff attitude. Facilities The hotel had free wireless internet access as well as a computer in the lobby for general use. Local Amenities The hotel was located in the heart of Sultanammet, about 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, AyaSofia and Grand Bazaar. There were some great places to eat (exit hotel, turn left, take first left and at top of the road, turn left again). On turning left, up the hill there was a mini supermarket and plenty of good restaurants. In particular, we would recommend the restaurant located opposite the mosque. Carrying on up the hill until the end of the road, if you turned left, you'd end up at the Grand Bazaar. There were also a lot of places to eat by the Blue Mosque and AyaSofia (exit hotel, turn left, first left and at top of the road, turn right) but I have to say there were really overpriced. So to sum up, would we stay there again? Yes definately.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel a lot”
Reviews.Author: bananalmd
Reviews.Content: my mother and i stayed at this hotel this past april 2008 and we both enjoyed the hotel. the location was perfect. It is within walking distance to the blue mosque, the haghia sophia, topkapi palace, and most of all, the grand bazaar. for those who enjoy shopping (and who doesn't), this would be the hotel for you. the staff was very accommodating, and, because the hotel only has 17 rooms, you can count on the personal attention. make sure when booking your accommodations, if you're travelling with a non-spouse or non-lover situation, you request for 2 beds. our travel agent here in the u.s. booked my mom & i in a double room, which, in europe, means, 1 double-sized bed, not 2 beds. when we expressed our concern to the front desk agent - selim han, 'mr. front desk' himself - he moved us to another room as soon as it became available. other than that, our experience at the stone hotel was wonderful, and will definitely recommend this hotel. louanna glendale, ca

HotelInfo.Name: Stone Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Binbirdirek Mah. Mehmet Pasa Yokusu no 34 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
